contra_indication: Adults over 55 years with new or recently changed symptoms
Long term conditions requiring regular pain relief
Perforation or bleeding (active or history of)
Not for use in Chicken Pox
If it has spread to the face
Do not use on broken skin or infected skin
Rectal bleeding or blood in the stool
Use on the eyes, face or ano-genital area
Digestive perforation or risk of digestive perforation
Taken monoamine oxidase inhibitors within the last 14 days
Moles, birthmarks, hairy warts or skin lesions
